doc.field: This layer contains data for the sewer interceptor system in the Twin Cities metropolitan area. Owned, operated and maintained by the Metropolitan Council Environmental Services division, the interceptor system provides the link from community sewer systems to the wastewater treatment facilities in the seven county metropolitan area.

<?xml version="1.0"?><metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Metropolitan Council</origin><pubdate>20131009</pubdate><title>Sewer Interceptor System (Limited Attributes)</title><mgmg1cid>N/A</mgmg1cid><pubinfo><publish>Metropolitan Council</publish></pubinfo><onlink>ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/InterceptorsLtdAttributes.zip</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>This layer contains data for the sewer interceptor system in the Twin Cities metropolitan area. Owned, operated and maintained by the Metropolitan Council Environmental Services division, the interceptor system provides the link from community sewer systems to the wastewater treatment facilities in the seven county metropolitan area.</abstract><purpose>To provide a digital inventory of Metropolitan Council, Environmental Services division owned pipelines for maintenance, planning and analysis.</purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20131009</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>dataset is up-to-date as of specified date.</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>As Needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-94.012</westbc><eastbc>-92.732</eastbc><northbc>45.415</northbc><southbc>44.471</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>None</themekt><themekey>sewer, sewers, waste water, sewage, sewerage, sewer interceptors, sewer systems, utilites</themekey></theme><place><placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey></place></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>None</useconst><browse><browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/InterceptorsLtdAttributes.jpg</browsen><browsed>Sample map showing the interceptors layer.</browsed></browse><native>ArcGIS 9x</native><crossref><citeinfo><title>Sewer Interceptor System (with full attributes) Abandoned Interceptors, Sewer Interceptor Lift Stations, Sewer Interceptor Meter Stations</title></citeinfo></crossref><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg><cntper>Tim Leach</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>Environmental Services Division</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>Minnesota</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651-602-1063</cntvoice><cntfax>651-602-1030</cntfax><cntemail>tim.leach@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac></idinfo><dataqual><logic>The dataset is topologically 'clean'.</logic><complete>Entire seven county geographic area is covered.</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>The positional accuracy of the dataset has not been tested under the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy. The positional accuracy of the dataset is estimated to be 20 ft.</horizpar></horizpa></posacc><lineage><srcinfo><srcscale /></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>This dataset was derived from as-built plan drawings. The data were transferred to ETAK street base files and later converted to match a 1992 (?) Minnesota Department of Transportation street base.
The Metropolitan Council is in the process of developing parallel data using GPS locations for more accurate positioning.</procdesc></procstep><procstep><procdesc Sync="TRUE">Dataset copied.</procdesc><srcused Sync="TRUE">L:\Metadata\Layers\interceptors-la</srcused><date Sync="TRUE">20071228</date><time Sync="TRUE">16135300</time></procstep><procstep><procdesc Sync="TRUE">Dataset copied.</procdesc><srcused Sync="TRUE">L:\Metadata\Layers\interceptors-la</srcused><procdate Sync="TRUE">20110324</procdate><proctime Sync="TRUE">09185400</proctime></procstep></lineage></dataqual><spdoinfo><indspref>None</indspref><direct>Vector</direct><mgmg3obj>arcs, nodes</mgmg3obj><mgmg3til>One layer for entire 7-county region.</mgmg3til></spdoinfo><eainfo><overview><eaover>LINE ATTRIBUTES
ID_NO: Name of interceptor
SYMBOL: 1 = gravity, 2 = force main, 3 = siphon, 4 = outfall, 5 = low-head, 6 = non-MCES pipe connecting remote MCES point, 8 = bypass
INT_SECT: Unique relate field based on numeric interceptor identifier and downstream point-to-point section identifier
DIMEN: Text description of pipe dimension</eaover><eadetcit>None</eadetcit></overview></eainfo><distinfo><resdesc>InterceptorsLtdAttributes</resdesc><distliab>NOTICE The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). - ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
